comment: His grading is hard but is a good teacher overall. You will learn something from him even if you don't want to
Good teacher! The test is not easy and he's a hard grader, but if you follow him the test should be ok. Learn a lot in his class, which makes Digi III easier for me.

Taught me both Circuits II & Electronics I (2300) simultaneously. Great professor, 1 of the best I have encountered at SPSU so far.  His tests are ok, however his grading is his major flaw. Quizzes make up 45% of your grade & the final could hurt you. Don't make mistakes on them, at least not often, that is key to even ensure passing his classes.
Wonderful prof. I would take him again. Very helpful if you need it. Tests are a little difficult but not too bad. Very nice

Its really according to which semester you catch him on.  Summer = easy.  Fall = toss-up.  He isn't really that hard, but his tests will kill you.  He doesn't give partial credit, so if you tend to make simple mistakes, they will be major mistakes here.  Nice guy, but its a gamble which grade scale he will give you.
The best prof. in the whole ecet department.  I wish he taught higher level ecet classes!
A good professor, but his grading is SUPER Strict! There is very little partial credit and he tries to confuse you on test! Good Teacher hard Grader, make sure you know your stuff!

Outstanding professor.  He presents the material in a cohesive and coherent fashion with a focus on practical applications.  The tests are straight foward; he's not trying to trick you. Again, outstanding professor.
Very easy tests, the questions are almost straight fro the homework.

I had hime for circuit I and II.  I got a B out of both classes from him.  He's helpful if u need his help.  His test are hard, but if u study then u will do just find.  Do the homework and study hard.  He's kinda boring with lectu to most people.  Over all he's cool.
He used Fundamentals as a weedout class.  He failed a good half of the class while the other half had to teach themselves.
Kim is a great guy and great professor.  Get to know him.  He was my professor for several classes and also interim dept. head.
